column4: I've had two hard X crashes in two days [IE, couldn't switch to another virtual console]
are there any logfiles I can check?
what card?
well, i825
but IIRC it uses the i810 driver
dunno about that one - does the man page for the driver have any info?
didn't check it. Whups
has nothing about logging
it may say nothing useful - I had an old s3 card and x hung a lot, and the man page said it was a known issue and had a workaround
any ideas where crash information might get logged?
/var/log/Xorg.0.log but I doubt you'll see anything useful if it hung
yeah, there's nothing useful there
not necessarily
I just googled his modem
it's a cable modem
http://linux-usb.sourceforge.net/SpeedTouch/ubuntu/index.html
it's a speedtouch he's talking about?
I've only used pppoatm with those
according to an ubuntu forum post, they may be equivalent
not much of a source though
he's talking about a cable modem connected via ethernet
